ygData.messageBody:
People with bad manners will always be around...I
chalk it up to poor parenting and/or being too
self-centered. I have found that by simply telling them of their
offense is enough to correct it...at least for the time
being. If not, then /ignore seems to do the trick
;-)<br><br>Personally I love to help others...specially newbies.
Nothing makes me smile more than to convert the 10
Pristine Scarab Carapice's that I drug over from Unrest
into Scarab Breastplates then to /shout a free
giveaway to first 10 noobs to poke me. Then just sit back
and watch all the little people come-a-runnin :-) I
cant tell you how many times those people have done
nice things for me in return...out of the blue,
because they remembered my actions...be it healing me in
a time of need...giving me a nice piece of
equip...providing services...etc.<br><br>I guess my point is that
most people want to interact in a positive way and
have fun...just like we do. Many times they do not
realize that they are being rude or discourteous by their
action or inaction. So it is up to us to point it out to
them. If they continue their rudeness then there are
other things you can do...most obvious being..to ignore
and not deal with them in the future. In my own
defense...I never assume that a port or a SoW is free (unless
grouped) and always offer to pay. More times than not,
payment is refused and we go on our merry way, both
feeling good. With the other time...it was money well
spent.<br><br>If any of you play on Bertoxx, send me a
tell.<br><br>Quynnelleon<br>Ranger of Tunare for 22 Seasons
